DOC.brief_summary: Female subject age 40 recruit randomised progressive resistance training ( PRT ) sham-exercise group . The PRT group train 80 % peak strength , use Keiser pneumatic resistance machine , progress approximately 3 % per session . Strength re-assessed fortnightly . Exercises target muscle around hip knee . The sham-exercise group train equipment PRT group except hip adduction , without add resistance progression . Both group train 3 day per week roughly 45 minute 6 month . It hypothesise high intensity PRT decelerate tibial femoral cartilage degeneration knee affect OA . Primary Outcome : Articular cartilage morphology follow 6 month high intensity progressive resistance training Secondary Outcomes : Muscle fat cross-sectional area ( CSA ) ( pre post ) Muscle strength , power , endurance , contraction velocity ( pre , 3 month , & post ) Medications ( pre , 3 month , & post ) Body composition ( pre , 3 month , & post ) Balance ; Physical function ( pre , 3 month , & post ) Questionnaires ( pre , 3 month , & post ) - Habitual exercise ( PASE ) -WOMAC index ( pain , stiffness functional ability ) - Depressive symptom ( Depression Scale ) -Quality life ( SF36 ) - Confidence perform physical activity ( Ewart ) -Demographics
